Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: leotb
Reviews.Content: Great service by staff, including over the phone before check in. Parking first come first served, but free. Great location for Alexandra Palace. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JLloyd4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raglan for 1 night on Sat Feb 11th, and can honestly say this is the best hotel we have ever stayed at!! Booking: Booked online, hotel sent clear directions on request on how to reach them by tube Arrival: Randy on reception gave a glowing first impression of the hotel- friendly, welcoming and no nonsense! He explained there were no double rooms left and upgraded us to a luxury double. Room: The room was lovely, clean and warm (Randy had told us about a boiler problem earlier that day, and went out of his way to ensure our radiators were working). The shower was superb. We believe the room was an adjoining room as we could hear our neighbours quite clearly!! The breakfast was fine, but it was the lovely staff who gave a lasting impression about the quality of the hotel. Right round the corner from the Ally Pally, (a chilly walk in the snow!) so brilliant location. If we're back in London, you'll be our first choice. (next time we'd like a cookie on the way out, we feel most left out after reading your other reviews!!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: beasy1204
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at this hotel because it was in a great location for seeing an event at the Alexandre Palace. The single room at The Raglan compares favorably with other single rooms I've stayed in England. The size of the room for a solo traveler is fine and the furnishings are all modern and in good order. One thing that really impressed me was the free Wi-Fi that they offered. I can't count the numbers of 4 and 5 star hotels that I've been to that either had no in room wi-fi, or if they did, it was offered at an outrageous price. When I compare my experience staying here to some of the earlier reviews that were posted for this hotel, I can tell that their management has worked hard to address issues brought up in these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay on Friday 27th January”
Reviews.Author: jprice1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on friday, this was a christmas gift from our children. The room was lovely and very clean, the staff were very friendly, the breakfast was lovely and hot and there was plenty. We would stay here again. Thank you to Red Letter days, this was booked through them, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Reet Petite!”
Reviews.Author: faith_in_U
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had stayed at the Roseview last year and thought we'd give The Raglan a try this time. From the outside the Raglan looks a bit more up-market than the Roseview further down the road and yet behind the ostentacious facade the 2 hotels are very similar. THE COST We booked the Raglan through Hotels.com and got a 10% discount on the room rate. For 2 nights we paid Â£135.00 instead of Â£150.00. We had to pay Â£8.95 each for full English breakfast (Â£35.80 for 4). Altogether the cost for the room for 2 nights and 4 breakfasts came to Â£170.80. THE ROOM We were given room 221 which was located on the second floor. Those with mobility problems need to be aware that there is no lift and many stairs. The stair carpet had seen better days in some areas, as did the overall decor on the stairs and landings. The room itself was tiny, and the walls were paper thin, you could hear people in the room above. It was well decorated, but not much room to move in. The dressing table was small and cluttered with all manner of things so it left little space for your own stuff. The bed was comfy but only a double (we are used to a kingsize), and the duvet had seen better days, it was thin.The bed linen was spotlessly clean, and there were 4 plump pillows. Towels in the spotlessly clean shower room were fluffy and white. Complimentary toiletries were also supplied. THE BREAKFAST Breakfast was good. Fresh juices, cereals, toast, lots of fresh coffee, tea etc, and the cooked Full English was good. It really did set us up for the day. Breakfast we would give full marks. One nice touch was when we were leaving we were given a couple of cookies and bottles of water for our journey home. Overall The Raglan is a decent hotel to stay at, it is clean with pleasant and courteous staff, and the breakfast is good. Whether it justifies its cost over that of the Roseview, as well as its rating of a 3 star 'boutique' hotel is questionable. The choice dear reader is yours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Ally Pally”
Reviews.Author: davestoz
Reviews.Content: Went to the darts at ally pally only a 15 min walk from this hotel so ideal location. Some of the players and commentators stay here to met Bristow at breakfast be aware though no lift and loads of stairs so not really for the not very mobile staff very helpful good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: axlrocky
Reviews.Content: This is a typical London hotel in as much as your not going to get absolute luxury like in foreign climes but the Raglan is not a bad stay. The rooms are small but well appointed and the TV, internet access and bed were all of an acceptable standard. There is a lot of stairs which is a pain but then that is to be expected in hotels that are in converted houses. the main thing that made the stay good was the service, we were going to an event at Ally Pally (short walk 5 mins) and wanted to get into Camden cheaply in the day, the reception provided maps, accurate directions and local transport timetables. Very impressive. I didnt take the breakfast option which I thought to be a little pricey (10.95 or 8.95 booked in advance) but smells coming from the kitchen seemed nice. There were plenty of local cafes and restaurants within a stones throw of the raglan. I wouldnt think it suitable for long stays in London but for a short weekend break where you are not expecting to be in the hotel much it is a reasonably priced solution.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: undercoverelephant
Reviews.Content: The Welcome is good. However having no lift and a heavy bag, it is not ideal. The stairs are creaky and the corridors need a repaint. I had an executive room, which was clean and a good size. The bed's mattress was cheap and thin. The noise from other rooms is quite a put off. One morning I was awoken, even though a "Do not disturb sign was on the door" Once the room was not cleaned at all. Rooms facing the road are best avoided. The Breakfast was first class as were the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Refusal to refund Laterooms booking”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked a two night stay with the Raglan through LateRooms (Â£85/night, 7th and 8th October) because he was exhibiting at Ally Pally 8th and 9th Oct. At the last minute (Thursday 6th Oct) the stand at the exhibition was cancelled; he immediately used the Laterooms site to cancell the booking. The cancellation was made approx 1.5hours after the 2pm cut-off time for cancellation, and Â£85 was charged to his credit card. I subsequently spoke to the Laterooms rep who in turn spoke to the Bookings clerk at the hotel and (to cut a long story shprt) we were refused a refund. My Husband also e-mailed the bookings clear himself, however the refund was still not forthcoming. I feel that the Hotel had ample time to rebook the room and Â£85 is a lot of money to a sole trader, which he can ill afford to loose. We are unlikely (as a couple, my company or my husband's company) ever to book this Hotel again, due to their intransigence. Should the general manager wish to reply to the above (and arrange a refund), please use helenm@kodit.com.

Reviews.Title: “Too cold!!”
Reviews.Author: BambiMoore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Raglan for one night after a wedding. First impressions were that I could not believe they charge Â£129 for such a small room. The room was also freezing cold although both radiators were on! The bed was uncomfortable and the duvet was so thin it was basically a sheet which didn't help the freezing conditions! The radiators did not come on in the morning either, we went to have breakfast which was ok then went back to the room to have showers before we checked out. The room was so cold I phoned through to reception, they explained the radiators are on a timer and they only come on when it goes below a certain temperature. I'm sorry but if your paying Â£120 for a room you should have a temperature control in your room and be able to do it yourself! All in all it was a very cold experience at the Raglan and I'm in no hurry to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: sheenamary
Reviews.Content: We were exhibiting at Ally Pally and this was convenient for leaving the car parked on the forecourt (limited spaces, you have to grab your chance at about 9.00am when the last lot of guests leave after breakfast) and stroll down Dukes Avenue to the bottom of the hill where there's a pedestrian entrance to the Palace grounds. The Standard Double room was small but comfortable and reasonably equipped and we had no problem with noise. We were on the second floor so had a climb up narrow staircases to get there but had great views over the neighbourhood from a large window. The breakfast was very good â€“ nice bacon and sausages, and fresh fruit to start. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were given a small bottle of water and a cookie "for the journey" when we left, which was a thoughtful touch. Less positive points: the carpets need renewing, especially on the stairs and corridors. The corridors and stairs are narrow so negotiating them with big bags is tricky. The shower in our room was very stiff to turn on and off, so much so we called reception the first morning because we couldn't turn it on at all, but they came within 2 minutes to sort us out. The room rate isn't cheap â€“ we paid Â£95 for Thursday night and Â£89 for Friday â€“ but you expect that with London fringes and it was worth the extra over a budget chain on the North Circular to be within walking distance of lots of shops and restaurants and the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel - poor staff / guest interaction”
Reviews.Author: Cudds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April for buisness , i flew into London from Spain by the time i arrived at the hotel it was the early hours of the morning . My company had given me a hotel room confirmation email when i arrived i was told by the night receptionist that my confirmation wasnt a guarentee , i said cant we sort it out in the morning he said NO .In is defense he did say that i could pay for the room with my own credit card . To cut a long story short my barclay card didnt work because i forgot to inform them i was going to use it in the UK . In the end my old option was to telephone my girlfriend back in spain so she could email the hotel with my credit card details , once this was recieved i was given a room .If i couldnt have got another way of payment i would have been removed from the hotel . In the morning i spoke to the day shift supervisor who questioned the night shift receptionist WHY he did not go with the email confirmation as the hotel had used my company on many occasions . To make things even worse the hotel room was not the best and im sure it wasnt one photographed for the hotel brochure - and when i returned back to the hotel i was given a gift of a bottle of red house wine ( i dont drink red wine ) and a complmentary free breakfast voucher ( i didnt need this as my company had paid for my breakfast ) All in all not the best hotel ive ever stayed in - i thought that hotels were all about the PEOPLE not the money . Very Poor Very Dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: SJC_NZ
Reviews.Content: We paid Â£98 for one night and chose this due to its proximity to Alexandra Palace (a short walk). First impression were excellent, very friendly staff on front desk. But then we ended up having a really bad experience so will never be back. Our stay ended up in an argument with manager, will detail this below. I'll list the good points first - friendly welcome, clean rooms, comfy bed. Then the bad - - Despite booking nearly 2 months in advance, we were given a small, dark, ground floor room facing a wall. Thought early bookings tended to get first pick of good rooms? - Thin walls, could hear conversations and bathroom noises from neighbour. - Fan in bathroom kept making loud noise for an hour after turning off so kept us awake. And then the worst thing was that we missed out on breakfast due to miscommunication, and were treated VERY rudely by staff. It's pretty simple, you sign in at reception, pay for breakfast in advance, and the form gives accurate breakfast times. I just glanced at it, so later when we got back to hotel from concert I asked the girl when breakfast ended. She said 10.30am. Then in the morning I double checked the info folder in the room, it also said 10.30am. So at 10:15am we went to dining room and were told it was over at 10am. Queried this at reception, and they confirmed it was 10am. I said I'd been told different and wasn't impressed. All they needed to do was say "sorry about the confusion, we'll refund the money for breakfast now." Instead, they got annoyed at me, pointed out extremely patronisingly that I had signed the form with the time of 10am stated on it. I said that wasn't really the point at all, could I get my money back? She didn't want to do it!!! I asked for the manager, he started repetitively lecturing me also. I said I was sick of hearing the same thing repeated, and that was no way to talk to a guest. "Just refund the money please so we can leave...". He just had to point out one more time that it said 10am on the form I signed. I was FURIOUS by this stage. What is it with customer service people who want to have the last word?? In conclusion, I did get my refund. Then went back to my room, grabbed the folder of hotel info that CLEARLY stated 10.30am and took it back to them as we exited. Did he apologise then for his rudeness. NO. Totally shocking experience over something so petty. Suggest reviewing all hotel info given to guests, and send all staff and management on a customer services course!!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelling_elisa
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for my parents and I came to the hotel in person long before their arrival, in order to choose the room personally. The staff was friendly. However at my parent's arrival they gave us a different room, far smaller and darker and with a view on the conditioning machine which blew hot air if you opened the window. Considered that there is no breakfast included and that we had a room quite different from our expectations (and from pictures on the website) it can be considered quite overpriced. Then I decided to book other hotels nearby for my parents' next visits.

Reviews.Title: “Randy saved the day!!”
Reviews.Author: howsam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Raglan 29th & 30th of June 2011, we had booked a double room at bed & breakfast rate Â£200.00 for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were informed that the hotels hot water system had broken down & they were waiting for a part so it could be fixed. We were allocated room 115, not great, very small double, crap view, not a great start...... So we dropped off our bags and off we went to explore London. Later that evening we decided to ask if we could change rooms, we are NOT people who ever complain, but just thought it might be worth a try, Randy the guy at reception was MORE than helpful, he apologised about the water & was willing to offer us a different room. New room was 301 and it was BRILL, very spacious double, FAB view, nice bathroom we couldnt have asked for more, OK, well hot water would have been nice but that was beyond their control, these things happen & it was back on the next morning!! Hooray!! A discount of Â£20 was given for not having hot water on the first night. Breakfast was nice, plenty to eat, nice choice of cereals, yoghurt, toast, full english even kippers if you so wished. Massive Thank-you to Randy, best receptionist ever, made our 2 night stay one to remember! All the staff were friendly & helpful, even the morning we left the chap on reception gave us photo-copy of map and directions to avoid road works on way home. Would stay again but would make sure we booked either room 301 or similar room.

Reviews.Title: “The last place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Baldchops
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for three days at the end of June 2011. I also stayed here in 2006,I couldn`t fault the Hotel. There was at that time B&B in with the price of the room. The rooms were spacious , clean , tidy. You had a key card to open your door which when you went out you took it with you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. This year the rooms where cut in half to make room for more customers. The key card is no more,you have a key now which you have to hand into the reception,where anyone can access your key and enter your room. If you want breakfast full english is Â£10, continental is Â£8 EXTRA The second day we were there the water was cut off so we could not wash or shower and there was no electric Was in bed sleeping when the fire alarm went off at 1o`clock in the morning. How they have Three stars I don`t know. (perhaps it was payed for) Went 5 houses down the road to the "Roseview Hotel" they do the same thing has the Raglan with Breakfast Â£10 cheaper . As I said before the worse Hotel in Muswell Hill (don`t even go there) I would recommend the "Roseview Hotel" every time

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely stay here last year and we've booked again for this year!”
Reviews.Author: KristyJane
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I go to the Alexandra palace every December. Last year we were a little worried after reading some of these reviews..... That said, these were all completely dispelled after we stayed! Hence our re-booking for this coming December! I should have writted a nice report last year but never got round to it so here it is...Take no notice of the bad stuff. This is a super hotel, its clean and upbeat with really friendly helpful staff. We had absolutely no complaints and its very reasonably priced. Its right in the middle of Muswell Hill and only a 15 minute walk to the Ally Pally. We are all middle aged (sad to say) and have stayed in many hotels - This is a really nice one, honest!

Reviews.Title: “Grotty and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: 7Danni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a friends wedding and were very disapointed. It was Â£130 for a nights stay and in return we had dirty sheets a broken kettle and a room the size of a large bathroom. Breakfast was not included either. Not deserving of the lovely area that it is in. A B & B would have been far better.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced very very noisey traffic non stop through night nd day”
Reviews.Author: naomigriff
Reviews.Content: Stated here as had an operation in the highgate hospital, taxi only cost Â£6 to get there and taxi to paddington station cost Â£18. Stayed here on a boiling weekend, rooms were like a sauna no joke. Had to open the windowsill but the traffic noise is Non stop couldn't wait to leave after 2nights as the traffic noise was mental. At night couldn't hear tv due to us having to have windows open. rooms at first glance look lovely but when I picked the book from desk it was covered in dust, hand prints and dust over furniture. Randy at reception was lovely, and beds were comfy. Id stay here again for the hospital but not during warm weather again it felt worse than being on hols, at least on hols u have fans, and air con.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Smell and expensive for what you don't get!!”
Reviews.Author: Muckers1
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel for one night only with a work colleague. A twin was booked and all appeared well at reception booking in. Randy was very friendly and helpful. After booking in we decided to go to our twin room to unload our bags before heading out for dinner. The room was a little on the small side but managable and when we opened the bathroom door a repulsive stench hit us coming into the room. Raw sewage was what it resembled and we immediatley went to reception to voice our concerns. Randy was only too happy to spray the bathroom with airfreshener for our return from our delicious Italian meal. This did not mask the smell at all so we kept the door shut all night as not wanting to make too much fuss. Although the smell did eventually creep its way under the door into the bedroon we were fortunate enough to be able to leave the window open all night otherwise. The room (although the Ragaln boasts its recent refurbishment) seemed dated and in need of a revamp the pics on the webside really do mask a multitude of sins on closer inspection the bedding smelt stale and the duvets did not even have a cover over them so very unhygenic in my impression. (I may just be fussy ) but at over Â£100 a night Iwould expect at least pleasant air, sheets and maybe a bottle of water. Anyway I would not recomment this to anybody unless they have no sense of smell, registered blind and no taste when it comes to a Full English Breakfast all self served for a bargain price of Â£17. On a positive note! Loads of great bars and resteraunts withing close proximity and the road is very quient for god nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “23 February 2011 - Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: stepnju
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raglan for 2 nights. Before our visit we had read the other reviews and wondered what we would find. The reception area was attractive. 24 hour reception. Our room was well furnished and bed linen attractive. The room had clearly been recently refurbished and had double glazing. We were aware that renovation work was being undertaken but this was unobtrusive. Breakfast was a simple continental one but perfectly adequate. There was an option to purchase a cooked breakfast. It was vey easy to get into central London. Bus stop only a couple of hundred metres and buses regular.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: landyman2
Reviews.Content: On first impression the hoel foyer was clean and welcoming. However once we were in the bedroom a totaly differnet picture presented itself. The room was tired and shabby. The bed was two beds pushed together which looked awfully huge but was surprisngly comfortable. The view from our room was of a huge ventiator duct about four feet from the window. Sleep on the first night was hampered by the disco, for a wedding party, below our room, but to be fair it did end at 11.45pm. On the second night a guest next door left his T.V. on all night, as a consequence I left feeling more tired than when I arrived. On the plus side, staff were kind and helpful, the breakfast was good and the restraunt area clean. There was only one hiccough when the waiter was addamant that we were room only and we knew that we were bed and breakfast. Once the booking form was checked, he wasted no time to say sorry. We do understand that he was diong his job. Over all, not the best that money can buy. If you are driving down, be aware that you may have fun tyring to find a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and dismal although the staff were helpful”
Reviews.Author: Hilwill
Reviews.Content: Having read the last review it was with some trepidation we checked in. As we were guests at a function there it had made sense to stay. . . Whilst the room was warm (in fact perhaps too warm although I am not complaining) the shower was ICY, the water must come straight from the mains. I managed to wash my hair in the basin but could not find a hairdryer, rang down and one was there within 3 minutes which was good - in fact the staff were the best thing about the hotel. Regarding the dust and filthy bathroom (very much in need of a serious clean and a re-furb) the problem appears to be the lighting. Well, the lack of it. The two bulbs in our room gave off a total of about 20 watts I think, not enough to read by anyway so the dust probably goes unoticed. There was a flat roof outside the window covered in cigarette ends, lovely. The breakfast plate was warm and on the second morning so was the food, I opted for the museli then changed my mind as I think it was sawdust. The tea was an interesting shade of grey. Even the food at the function was pretty grim although they did manage to find a slice of lime for my drink. Soundproofing is non existant - I did not want to listen to the Superbowl, sadly the man in the next room did. They are doing some work to the hotel it appears, however, they really need to raise their game if they want to stay in business I feel - not a place for us again anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Experience”
Reviews.Author: OJJGolf
Reviews.Content: Having recently had the unfortunate experience of staying at this so called 'hotel' I have felt it is my duty to inform anyone who is thinking of making the mistake I did, not to! Simply the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, the carpet is wearing through, the rooms are tiny and freezing and the bathrooms are a joke, IF you get water coming out your shower it WILL be freezing COLD, morning or night. The breakfast is served cold on cold plates, all in all a thoroughly disgusting experience. So much so myself and my colleagues will be reporting the hotel Find somewhere else to stay, the streets would be better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Alexandra Palace”
Reviews.Author: JSandA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for the darts at Alexandra Palace, mainly because it's the closest hotel to the venue. But it is a good hotel, this was our second time staying and will book again in the future

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather stay on the streets”
Reviews.Author: Stephania094
Reviews.Content: First i arrived and wasn't too impressed anyway, as the pictures are very decieving. I had a family room, which was a little better, but all my friends had double rooms and could barely move the room was that small. Also the hotel is very confusing, too many staircases etc. The heating was on full blast in the hotel and was very claustrophobic, as the halls were very narrow anyway. Anyway so we went out, came back and unfortunatley someone forgot the key in the room, but obviousley didnt think this would be a problem, as there would be spare in the reception and could get the key back. Well, we thought wrong. There was no spare copy, there was also no master key. The manager said we had to wait till 9am in the morning for the housekeeper to come to open the room. We were then given another room to stay in, with none of our belongings as everything was in the room. 9am came, and the housekeeper didnt even have a key, instead the lock had to be changed, as it was changed, all the mess was still left all around our door etc. On check out, the service on reception was disgusting, and didnt understand our issue, and said it wasnt her fault, but infact mine. I refused to pay, but then in the end as i was arguing for endless amount of time, i agreed to Â£15 off, but im still not happy at all, and would very much rather sleep in the car then go back there.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star well not quite!”
Reviews.Author: thebarnB&B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from what should have been a memorable weekend, well it is but for the wrong reasons. Hotel reccommended by friends as a good place to stay whilst in North London for their wedding reception. Grotty doesn't do it justice. 3 star? have stayed in far better 3 star hotels, this is a miserable example.Part of the Belsize Park Group according to the reseipt.Located in Queens Avenue. Only 5 parking spaces, we were lucky as my husband is disabled we bagged the only disabled bay there! Reception staff friendly and efficient, room very small, bed even smaller 4 foot wide for 2 people,on one side you could just squeeze down the side to get in. narrow corridoors and stairs ( we wondered about fire regs), no lift of help with luggage, no hot water to the shower, had to ask for milk as there wasn't any and only 2 tea bags! Lots of extras,the shower gel and shampoo had been used previously and had dribbles down the tubes! nice!breakfast sad and served on icy cold plates. Would we stay there again? wild horses wouldn't drag me there! Over priced for a 3 star. One to avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay, staff friendly and helpful and bed comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: ecadventurer
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a pleasant stay.,staff could not have been more helpful. A little distance from tube into central London,but get the 43 or 143 bus 8 mins travel to Highgate and its less than 30 mins to central London.We stayed in a triple bedded room and it was comfortable enough for us with our son.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...EVER!”
Reviews.Author: lesliepaul37
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for business. I arrived at 2130hrs to be greeted by a very smiley but extremely useless receptionist. Having had a long journey I asked what time the restaurant closed and was informed that the hotel didn't have one. Upon opening the door to my room a nauseating smell of faeces hit me (Iâ€™ve worked in hospitals and care homes for over 30 years and know the smell). I checked the bathroom but this smelt wonderful...it was coming from the carpets. The loo seat fell off at the first touch, the hand basin immediately overflowed when I tried to wash my hands and the nice looking 4-poster bed was as hard as a rock. I chose not to have a bath or shower as I have had typhoid before and didnâ€™t want a repeat. The hotel is very noisy, not in a good location i.e. 20 walk from the nearest tube station and the food is fair to bad. If you value yourself donâ€™t stay here. I work for a large national organisation and we have taken this off of our satisfactory list of hotel so I will never be going back there and neither will any of my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whickhammob
Reviews.Content: I was booked in at short notice. Parking in London is hopeless so I took the train. The front desk staff were VERY helpful with getting me on and off tubes and buses to my various appointments. My room was clean and comfortable with a nice full sized bathroom, tea and coffee and a hair dryer-plenty of towels and room service was fine too. Really friendly helpful staff who made me sandwiches when I came in late one night. The breakfast was plentiful-toast ,yoghurt , fruit , Danish pastries,or a cooked breakfast to order- I believe there were kippers too. Lashings of tea and coffee. I really don"t know what on earth everyone is complaining about. Muswell Hill is also a nice residential area and is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room, poor parking”
Reviews.Author: foodieHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Raglan when attending my nieces wedding. Our room was awful. Tiny, with just a few inches either side of the bed and nowhere to our our bags except the floor where we tripped over them. The room was not clen - thick dust on top of the tv, and one of the tea mugs had a big chip in it. My sister paid exactly the same for her room and it was lovely - spacious and clean. Why the difference, we paid the same rate? At the wedding dinner, my partner was given his main course, and the rest of our table got theirs 10 minutes later! We told him to start, the staff then realised they had made a mistake and tried to take his plate away half eaten! Instead of giving the rest of us our food, they made us wait as it wasn't our turn! Parking is awful - pot luck if you can get a space in the road so be prepared to drive around looking for one. Breakfast was nice, but not worth the extra (Â£10 for full english) unless you can get a B&B deal. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vile”
Reviews.Author: MrT23Uk
Reviews.Content: What a load of rubbish Â£100 a night for a hotel that smells like a butchers. The food is dire, they had 3 things on the menu, i asked for canneloni and to be honest wasn't expecting much but when it came it was a tough as leather. The bar man couldn't have cared less, the food was a microwave meal with some salad that was just about within sell by date. The man on reception kept me waiting for 10 mins before he served me, I arrived and he saw me and then walked off. No "I'll be one minute sir" Definetly by far the worst hotel I have stayed in in London (and I have stayed in a few)

Reviews.Title: “Be warned. Don't book with another website”
Reviews.Author: AllanNorwich
Reviews.Content: We booked with another website to get a cheaper deal. It turns out they can only book the few inferior rooms. Don't be tempted! There were no proper drawers. There was a gap of less than 2 feet either side of a small double bed. There was very little space at the end of the bed and just a narrow coridor to the door. The hotel looks OK from outside but it hides a sequence of dingy narrow corridors hiding a mish mash of rooms. The service was OK. The breakfast was OK apart from when we went down early to be greeted with leathery bacon mashed beans and a cold selection from food that had stood for ages.

Reviews.Title: “[--]”
Reviews.Author: fredHampshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a scam advertising as something they realy are not !!!!!! we stayed here a week ago and thats we arrived at :THE RAGLAN: as we came in the hotel didnt have eny praking !! so we whent to the reception and spoke to a lady EVA. the problem got even worse !! she woz just simply sed uselessseeee !! enyway the reception filthy .... we found a parking space aboute 5 miles away ... then the reale nighmere came we then whent to the staires crakly noisy ... the room very small (tiny) the shower broken anly 5 chanels all not in tune dirty room .next the restorant woz ok but the menu didnt have enything that they wher offering so only expensive boos ?? i dont need to say more as i hope this will help people i there desition to stay in THE RAGLAN.........

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: 40slady-10
Reviews.Content: Having booked a weekend stay before reading the reviews, we arrived with some trepidation and were immediately reassured by our friendly welcome and the general ambience of the hotel. Our twin room was small (as we had expected), but how much space does one really need in a hotel? It was spotlessly clean - as were all the rooms we used - and all the usual facilities were provided, such as tea, coffee, biscuits, tissues etc. The beds were comfortable, and the lighting was better than in many larger hotels we have used. The location could not have been more convenient, as we were far enough out of the city to be able to breathe fresh air, and the journey into central London was really easy - a short bus ride to the tube, and then access to all areas. Just around the corner from the hotel were shops of all kinds, and the restaurants were varied and served great food. The only slight drawback was some traffic noise during the night, but, as a light sleeper, I always use earplugs and would deem them essential for other light sleepers. The breakfast was brilliant! Neither of us could manage a lunch after one of those. All in all, an experience we will be repeating when next in London

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever ever ever stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: plasticinesausage
Reviews.Content: This must be the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. We chose this hotel as we were visiting friends in the area and the website sold the hotel quite well. When we arrived all of the car park spaces were reserved for a private function so we had to park at the local supermarket which was nearly a 10 minute walk. the room itself was quite modern but obviously done on a budget. The mattress was lumpy and the TV had sound but no picture. The delay caused by trying to find a parking place meant that we didn't have time to go to a restaurant like we had planned so we resorted trying to order room service from the extremely basic menu. After finally getting through to the reception to order 2 sandwiches we were told that due to the private function they were unable to serve food to the room and the restaurant itself is only open for breakfast. We felt that all our needs were being neglected because they were too busy trying to keep their larger booking happy. Although the room itself was relatively clean, some of the corridors leading to it were absolutely filthy with thick dust and dirt on the skirting boards. In the morning we popped down to reception to get a couple of soft drinks and were told that the bar was closed and they couldn't possibly walk to the other side of the room and sell us 2 colas. the general unhelpfulness of the staff was unbelievable. It was as if they didn't even realise how objective they were being and at Â£115 a night for such an abysmal package, it felt like robbery! I strongly advise anyone wanting to stay in Muswell Hill to not be fooled by the seriously misleading website and steer well clear of the Raglan.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear.....”
Reviews.Author: jera1905
Reviews.Content: I phoned the hotel to ask what time I could book in and was told 3pm...when I looked at some small print in an email they had sent previously I found it was actually 2pm - staff being less than accurate fro the word go was not a good impression. I was in room 202 and was getting on with some work in preparation for the next day when the next door neighbour decided to start playing an electric guitar!!! This was from the property next door but the noise was awful. I was moved to room 224 which I was assured was quiet (there was a bit of a hum from the aircon fans which must have been on the roof above but it was just about tolerable). All was going ok until about 5.30 am when I was woken by the crashing of trolleys from some delivery to the hotel. Oh - and the food??? There is a pre-dial for the restaurant and bar on the room phone. The restaurant didn't even ring and gave a tone like the phone had been left off the hook. The bar rang but was never answered so in the end I went through reception. Not impressed. Well a lasagne cost Â£9.00. It was clearly a microwave job (the cheese was pale and obviously hadn't been anywhere near an oven/grill and IT WAS LUKE WARM!!! I sent it back and they heated so that it was actually edible. The continental breakfast was basic to say the least. I had a picture of something like a croissant but oh no - weetabix (no sugar available) a bowl of melon (which was bland and had a hard, woody texture) and toast. not worth the extra frankly. The room had cobwebs on the light and the shower curtain had 6 inches of gap at the bottom so the water went everywhere. I stayed at the hotel through necessity and frankly I would only ever go back there as a last resort or if location was more important than service or value for money. Raglan - your manager will be getting an email very soon!!! Awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: sweet4
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights,and would not go back,we booked a double room,which was small,and as others say it is hot, there is no air conditioning. We were the only people at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie511
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews on this hotel, I was a little nervous at what it would be like - I shouldn't have worried! We stayed for 3 nights in a very clean modern room (maybe a little scuffed here and there) and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The staff were lovely, great breakfast and waitress and at an extremely good price! The hotel is one minute from bars and restaurants, with an excellent bus service to the tube. Maybe those who had found the staff unhelpful in the past, had been to a different hotel, or were perhaps rude themselves, as nothing seemed too much trouble for those we met! .N.B. If you are booking through an agent, please be aware that the booking is initially made in the agents name - not yours. This can lead to a little confusion if you ring to check on your booking, but is easily resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NWPDWR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice area of North London and it is ideally located to get to the shops and restaurants of Muswell Hill. There is no tube station in Muswell Hill, so getting into central London is more of a chore than from other areas. There are two 24hr buses that run from the Broadway to Highgate tube and beyond. The hotel lobby, breakfast area and bar are really nicel. The rooms are very small but well decorated and the shower was great. After a bad start (issues with having my reservation confirmed), I would stay again. The hotel staff redeemed themselves and I had a lovely time at the Ragland

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: MerseysidePinkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Room 211 - shower screen had no rubber on the bottom and so every time you used it, the bathroom floor got soaked. Sink also leaked, leaving big puddle on floor. Toilet was disgusting, brown, ground in stains at the bottom, in need of a bottle of bleach down it. Mattress felt really old and worn. No air con. Way too noisy outside to leave window open for air. Very rowdy bar in hotel. Do yourself a favour and look for something else. Room service next day only changed towels and made beds, no tea bags or milk left, dishes not taken from room and cups not washed. Just not good enough!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get a discount”
Reviews.Author: Bellie710
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel with a really good discount so the room only cost Â£57 including breakfast. I wouldn't have been that impressed if we had paid the full price as the room was very small and quite basic only a bed a desk and a small wardrobe but it was clean

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had checked this site first avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: shahug
Reviews.Content: I normally always check trip advisors website before booking any hotel I didnt this time and boy am I sorry I had booked this hotel by the website was very impressed with how they sold their hotel was expecting big things and god was I upset when we got to our room!! when we walked into the lobby was happy enough everything was modern and stylish when I was asked to pay on arrival I was quite suprised (not so much now as you would probably leave straight away) then when they said there was no lift I was horrified you walk behind the reception to get to the staircase where only one person can fit at a time old creaky steps we had four flights to go to get to the second floor where our room was when we walked in I nearly died it was TINY two steps from the door was the bed and there wasn't even room for one person to walk around the bed and the heat would have knocked you down when you walked into the room ( had to pretty much keep the window open all weekend) the bathroom was literally when you sat on the toilet you could wash your hands and the shower was the other side of sink and was tiny you could bearly fit in it...I know london hotels the rooms can be small but this was ridiculous for the price you pay Â£285 for 3 night room only and then they have the cheek to ask you for Â£8.50 for breakfast!! would never go back here again and the bull that they put on their website NOT IMPRESSED thankfully we did that much sightseeing we virtually only slept in the room but the first night we got there they had some kind of party on where they opened the bar from 2.30am to 5am and the guests were pretty noisy and as we had to sleep with window opened didnt get any sleep!! I would never recommend this hotel Muswell Hill Hotel down the hill much better friend of ours stayed in it room was average size included breakfast and it was only Â£60 a night that is were we will be staying if we return as at least Muswell Hill Hotel doesnt sell itself to be anything other than what it is shame on you Raglan Hall.....

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but good location and food.”
Reviews.Author: FrogDad
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the size of the room I had been allocated at the Raglan, but they had tried their best to give it a modern look and it was nice and clean. The hotel as a whole was clean with nice polite staff and the breakfast was nice. It is a stonmes throw from the shops, bars and restraunts of Muswell Hill so suited our purpose perfectly. I'd stop here again, but ask for a larger room (Like my collegue got. GRRRR!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Gemma101Bristol
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand what the previous bad reviews are going on about! We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of January and thought it was superb right from the moment we checked in. Our room was lovely and clean as was the bathroom. We found all the staff very helpful indeed and the breakfast was very good with lots of choice and the portions were excellent. All iln all a very good stay and would definitely go there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: duke99hull
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Raglan the week before christmas and the hotel was excellent. We had a room on the top floor of the hotel, which was modern, spacious, clean and tidy. The bathroom was lovely and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, very good choice with excellent portions. The quality of the food was also very good. We used the hotel mainly as a base as the purpose of our visit was to spend time in London. I would certainly stay at the hotel again. The staff are all very friendly and Muswell Hill is trendy with some nice Restaurants and coffee shops to visit. The hotel does not have parking, however it only took me 5 minutes to find a space near the hotel on the street and it was free of charge for the duration of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “DREADFUL - Makes Fawlty Towers look like a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: bolli39
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we chose to stay here on our wedding night as we were going to the Rufus Wainwright concert at Kenwood. It was truly awful. From our arrival when the reception staff denied any knowledge of our online booking despite us having a printed confirmation with us which we presented them with. They were extremely rude and very very unhelpful. After about an hour they finally found us a poky little room but not the 4 poster we had booked (and already paid for - more later). The terrace was 'unavailable' we later discovered this was because a party was booked for that evening. Friends were joining us to celebrate our marriage that morning with a glass of champagne - guess what? No champagne - they finally managed to rustle some up about 20 minutes later. Throughout all of this the reception staff particulary the head receptionist made us feel as if they were doing us a favour. I do not think any of them are familiar with the concept of service and that when dealing with customers you operate on the basis that you the hotel may be at fault until you sort it out. They argued and argued that we had not already paid even though I knew I had seen it on our credit card statement and were vehement in their insistence that it was a pre-authorisation. Finally we were in the poky little room after hauling bags up a cramped shabby staircase and corridor relieved to be away from the AWFUL receptionist when she knocked on the door. I was so upset by this point I told them to go away the knocking persisted and I finally went to the door. Faced yet again with the awful receptionist and an events manager who said the general manager was unavailable but would speak to us both the following morning and that our room for the evening would be complimentary but not the champagne and flowers we had ordered for our room. We were staying in a family room the following night with our children to spend time with our friends in London. We went out for the evening and thankfully had a great time at the concert but stayed out as late as we could to avoid going back to the hotel. We met the manager the following morning who was superficially sympathetic and quite charming but refused my request for the receptionist to sit in on the chat with us as I wanted to speak to her about her behaviour the previous day. We did not have to pay for the room on our wedding night but did for the family room on the Sunday. He invited us to return to the hotel as complimentary guests for the weekend I feel however this was merely to ensure we paid for the room on the Sunday evening and was not a sincere offer. The housekeeper at the hotel was lovely and the only genuine member of staff we had any dealings with. When we arrived home I checked our credit card statement and we had indeed already paid for the room. We raised this with the manager Thomas on the phone - again we were told it was a pre-authorisation and our card had not been debited. He then refused to respond to further e-mails and said he would do nothing unless he could see our credit statement. There was no offer to check his own records or look into it at their end he insisted he would do nothing without our credit card statment. After the treatment and behaviour we had already received at their hands we were unwilling to do this. We had to raise a dispute with our credit card company and received a refund from them. Needless to say we have not pursued his disingenuous offer of a complimentary stay.

Reviews.Title: “awful!”
Reviews.Author: sue032
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for one night in this "fashionable"hotel.I certainly will not be returning.I found the hotel to be very shabby,the carpet in the corridor leading to the rooms was ruttled up and in need of a good clean.I eventually found my room up two flights of stairs(no lift)down the far end of the hotel and through several doors.It was what I can only describe as a cupboard,it was so tiny ,.It was above the kitchen so I heard banging all evening and outside my window was a large funnel where all the smells and steam were coming from the sushi restaurant downstairs. All in all it was awful,I would not send my worst enemy here!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers are being particularly hard”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyJoWendy
Reviews.Content: Some of the recent reviews have been unnecessarily hard on this hotel. It is not bad for a 3 star in the outskirts of London. Admittedly it has a few problems - like no parking, very narrow stairs, small rooms and shower rooms (no bath) but this is London! The staff were always pleasant and helpful, and breakfast was very reasonably priced and food plentiful and freshly cooked. We did miss a tea/coffee maker but the coffee at breakfast was very good. Requests for more hangers and an iron/ironing board were promptly and willingly fulfilled and, because of the stairs, we were asked if we needed help with our bags. Our room was sparse but very clean, smart and comfortable. To stay for 3 or 4 nights would not be a problem (we did). Double Decker bus service into the city tourist spots was fun and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: skippy27
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel because it is within walking distance from friends who live in north London. However, there was total disorganisation from the start. Initially, I booked via the hotel website - four-poster with B&B for 2. I got a phone call the following day to say the hotel had been refurbished and although they could not give us the four-poster, they could offer the Executive room for the same price. I accepted. About a month before we were due to go, I thought I would just check that the booking was definitely made. Thank goodness I did because they had no record of it. I made a new booking and gave my credit card details - and here is the big problem. Just before our stay, my credit card statement showed that they had taken Â£99 on the day of booking. When we booked in, they told me that this was being held by the credit card company as security, and had not been taken by the hotel. On checking out, I then had to pay the full amount. In addition, there is a general air of chaos. The staff look demoralised and are generally unfriendly. Our room was hot and stuffy (even on a relatively cool night), without any window that opened more than 3 inches. Bathroom cramped. Tiny, awkward staircase from the lobby, and no lift. I would never stay here again, or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An englishperson needs tea!”
Reviews.Author: thefleapalace
Reviews.Content: I left my home comforts of at least being able to have a cup of tea to stay in a doss house. The room resembled something I would expect from a night shelter. There were no tea making facilities nor were we able to easily obtain a cuppa. The tea in the morning resembled very weak wee wee and when I asked for a tea bag I was greeted with a scowl. Although I did not pay for this hotel, as it was booked by an organisation for 16 of us, I would never in a million years recommend it even as somewhere to rest your head for the night. The bedsprings were poking up through the mattress and the bottom of the divans were bare and resembled old very stained tic pillows. The staff were not particularily helpful and this added to the aggravation. Having backpacked throughout Europe I am used to slumming it but did not expect to slum it in a Â£185 a night hotel. Two of the most miserable nights I have ever had! DON'T STAY THERE - IT IS TRULY AWFUL! Bare wires in the bathroom and it was so small you had to be a size 6 to comfortably get into it. Toilet paper appeared to be rationed - at least I did not have a gippy tum - not sure what I would have done then!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Londoner555
Reviews.Content: The website for this hotel makes it look like a beautiful boutique hotel. It is not. The rooms are tiny. We were in a newly refurbished room, but the carpet, bed and duvet will still old and stained. It had merely been repainted and new sheets and a fancy bed head put in. I asked to move rooms and was shown a couple of others - ours was the best of a bad bunch. We didn't have a bath, or the tea/coffee maker promised and the "cable t.v." only had terrestrial channels, sky news and sky one. The newspaper we ordered also never appeared. The smell from the paint fumes was overwhelming and made us nauseous - particularly as the window only opened a couple of centrimetres. The hotel corridors are shabby and very narrow, with steep stairs and no lift. The hotel staff tried their best, but there was only ever one person behind reception trying to cope with what appeared to be a number of very unhappy/disappointed guests. I would strongly advise against staying at this hotel if you are looking for a romantic/nice place to stay as a treat. If you just need a cheap bed for a night then it is probably fine - the location is at least good.

Reviews.Title: “Raglan rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Tgra5
Reviews.Content: We had a specific requirement for our stay, as we needed a baby cot for our 1 year old toddler. I made at least a dozen phone calls to the hotel before our stay to confirm the cot and make sure we had a room with enough space for us and the baby. Because I booked through Ebookers, the hotel had no record of me until the day before our reservation. The room we were given was claustrophobic for a single person and impossible for three. The cot was squashed up against the bed, which had less than a foot of space around it in any case. There was only one overhead light and no lamps or bed lights so once the baby went to sleep we were banging around in the dark trying to find our pyjamas. There was no space in the room for our luggage, which had to be stored 3 flights down in a room off the lobby. I never did find my toothbrush. The bathroom was equally small, and the shower was so tiny that it was impossible to raise your arms inside. The room was clean and the staff were fine but we wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. There were some deluxe rooms that probably had more space (judging by the hotel website) but most of the rooms were this inhumane size.

Reviews.Title: “Polished website and Reception area - totally deceptive.”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie1975
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for one night with 3 other couples. We all paid Â£95 and all received totally differnt standards of room. One was a 4 poster, one was average and acceptable (ours) one was below average for sure and the other, totally awful with a tiny weeny bathroom, not enough room to move around the bed or the room (as a couple). We had to make a fuss on arrival as they had booked us instead of 2 doubles, a twin and a double. despite writing on our booking form that we had been down graded from a 4 poster to a double due to non availability. To make the twin room a double, they had the ingenious idea of shoving the single beds together and rearranging the bedding. Which of course was perfect. Ahem. They tried to charge us 10% service on a round of drinks from the bar. However we couldn't even stand up at it to order our own drinks to avoid a service charge as it had the shutters down! Would stay here again if they dropped their prices, and made sure they accurately described the rooms and maybe toned down the website to something less ambitious for their actual status.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive reception for a shabby hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maltababy
Reviews.Content: The website is very impressive, thought we'd stumbled across a 'real gem'. First negative aspect was the email confirming my booking (about 2 weeks before we visited) informed me that the cancellation policy was like no other hotel I'd booked before, in that you could only cancel up to a month before your visit!! Booked the hotel as we were going to a concert at Ally Pally. Arrived to a highly polished marble reception area and booked in. Ordered a couple of Sunday morning papers and made our way up to our room. The door off the reception looked 'shabby', we opened it and climbed up a 'shabby' badly fitted brown carpet. My heart started to sink. Got to our freezing cold room. What a strange room, looked like was half way through a refurb and the money ran out. The double bed was tiny in length (my 6ft 4' husbands legs hung out the end all night!) and there was no valence covering the bottom part of it, which took my eyes down to the carpet, yuk! The carpet and the curtains were just hideous...reminded me of a dreadful flat I lived in about 20 years ago that was furnished by the landlord. The bath room had a disgusting pink shower curtain hanging around the bath which matched the equally awful dated tiles on the walls (including the cracked ones), When we left the concert we decided to go back to the hotel for a few drinks, the main bar was closed and we were directed to the empty sushi restaurant (part of the hotel) and had a beer each, as they don't sell shorts in here. Another couple came into the bar about 5 mins after us (by this time it was 11.15 on a Sat night) they were told that the bar was now shut!! As we went up to our room another chap was clearly annoyed and complaining about both the hotel bars being shut (by then about 11.30). Breakfast was OK, but not what you expect these days from a decent hotel, there was no buffet spread/croissants or fruit etc. Instead you had to choose from a choice of three options..healthy (cereals etc) cooked or something else. I always get excited about the breakfasts when I'm stopping in a hotel, but this restricted menu wasn't really anything to get excited about. No sign of our papers either. Not overly impressed and wouldn't stop here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: brucibaby9
Reviews.Content: The room smelled horribly from the perfume they used to cover the smell of the dirty room. We spent our first night there scouring the neighborhood looking for another hotel that had a vacant room. What a waste of our vacation time. Certainly a waste of our money. The staff was not surprised that we were upset nor were they surprised when we moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay”
Reviews.Author: aloe78
Reviews.Content: Oh, well. I was there at the same time as the weddingparty. WE booked it beacuse of the nice web site and eventhough I read bad reviews I though I would ask for the refurbished room and we will be ok. WEll refurbished means, that they painted one wall brown color and pur brown pillows on the bed ( terribly small as well). IT was dirty! The front desk was so, so. They had to feel badly for the guests as well I think. We cancled our last night and after viewing of all hotels in the neighberhood we stayed next doors and Roseview, which was at least clean and actualy had nice feel to it. IT is as well being refurbished.DO not give them business, please.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly ruined a great wedding day FILTH”
Reviews.Author: reptile_mat
Reviews.Content: I will not be able to fit the amount of complaints i have in this space but the main point i want to make is DO NOT BOOK A WEDDING HERE. On first impression this looks nice but WAIT all is not what it seems Luckily our general high spirits managed to make the most of the occasion. The rooms were small and i mean small I could just about clean my thumbs in the sink. The hangers in the hanging spot (not wardrobe) were sticky and unclean. Nearly all of the supposed features of the hotel on their website, like the bar til 3a.m, 50inch screen. Were blatant lies. They are just not there. We were chucked out to the lobby at 11.30pm Being told that the agreement we had with the management was verbal and not valid, even after the wedding had been booked for almost a year and checking a week before everything was in order. They have had some recent problems with management leaving. This does not surprise me but is no excuse. Its simply not good enough. Do not use unless you are willing to pay over the odds, want for nothing and are not bothered by small unclean spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Not a best Western or best anything”
Reviews.Author: rod_collins
Reviews.Content: Poor access to advertised facilites due to private functions which is a regular occurence. Lounge bar closed but not advised at booking or subsequently. Noisy from private function at the front of the hotel until 3:00am. Management not even willing to talk to guests directly to resolve minor problems. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to poor management attitude,

Reviews.Title: “What a con!”
Reviews.Author: percy63
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be prosecuted under the Trades Descriptions Act. It has not (as described in the website) been fully refurbished. Once past the 'boutique' fascade of reception, bar and restaurant you're in for a shock. The clues are there - look behind reception at the grotty carpet and cheapo fridge in prime position; check out the poorly applied paintwork; marvel as you climb the claustrophobic staircase, at the stained carpet etc - and that's before you're in the room. This was once a best western hotel - a bad Best Western and was bought by some 'brothers' apparently? Best Western were well rid! The room I was in (a double) was small and dingy and the 'brothers' had obviously tried to justify the refurbished tag by fitting a tacky headboard, a cheap bedside lamp and mfi furniture to compliment (not!) the 80's curtains, carpet and bedding. Chipped and smeared paintwork, dreadfully applied wall paper and a dank musty smell appeared when I squeezed myself into the room, passing what was the world's smallest ensuite bathroom. I later attempted to have a shower under the dribble that came from the 20 year old shower head soothed by the vision of mouldy and patched silicon sealant around the ancient bath. Yuk! Breakfast was a bland affair served in the function room - not the funkier restaurant next door. The room had all the grace of a village hall complete with speakers and carpeted stage area in case the customers wanted to set up a naff disco over their boot- leather bacon. One woman was overheard to mention politely to an eastern european waitress (twice) that said bacon had run out. The waitress disagreed, went to the container and lifted the lid. Look, bacon! she exclaimed, pointing at some rapidly drying sausages. Breakfast never happened the second day as I was 4 minutes beyond the 9.30 breakfast cut off. Even though it was all still laid out, there was no way in to the village hall. Another dissatisfied customer had been 1 minute late - she too was refused. All in all a miserable experience and you would be better off in a Travelodge - not this 'boutique' hotel. How they have the gall to publish such a misleading website is beyond me - there should be a law. Incidently, I did have a drink in their designer bar complete with 'decks'. It wasn't busy. Probably because the barman (with just me there) had a foul flatulence problem - charming. Maybe that accounts for the dank and musty smell?!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined My Wedding Night.”
Reviews.Author: JK1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no longer part of the Best Western chain but is spoiling the good name of Best Western hotels. We booked a room at the Raglan Hall even though our wedding reception was at another location. We've been to Flutes Restaurant several times before and since we love the restaurant, thought that the hotel would be as good...How wrong we were! We arrived at the reception desk after midnight on the night of our wedding. The man at the desk did not seem to really know what he was doing but after about ten minutes, we finally got the key to our room. After climbing the stairs in my wedding gown and with our overnight bags, we opened the door to our room to find someone else's belongings there. They'd obviously double-booked the room. We went back down to reception, where the man at the desk told us that there were no more rooms available but they could book us into another hotel nearby. After an hour of waiting and getting more and more upset with the situation, the barman, who'd been called in to help, told us that the man at the desk had made the mistake. Our room was still available, he'd just given us the wrong key! Obviously we were not pleased with this shoddy service. Eventually we went up to our room but found that the Champagne we had pre-ordered, was not chilling in our room, so clearly the people at the front desk had just lied to us. This was not our original room and they had double-booked our room. We were extremely pissed off by this time - it was already 2 am and our wedding night had been ruined. We showered in the badly designed bathroom - the screen on the bathtub was pointless as the water splashed around the side of it, soaking the whole bathroom. We slept in the musky-smelling bed and when we checked out in the morning, we were still expected to pay the full price of Â£115 for room even though that didn't include breakfast and we had had such a terrible night! We have since only been offered a refund of Â£30, which of course we will not be accepting. Don't stay here - avoid this hotel at all costs and tell your friends to do so as well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice public facade - shame about the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Muswell Hill is unfortunately one of those london hotels that I hate. They update reception, make it look a boutique hotel by updating reception and put that on the website but fail to update the rest of the hotel to suit. immediately that you go through the doors from reception the decor changes to the distinctly shabby. knocked about decor, really narrow corridors. The rooms are more like a reasonable B&B than a hotel, chintzy curtains and dated bathroom fittings - nothing like the modern reception interior suggested - you feel most cheated! The hotel did however have a nice restauarant, and as a lone woman traveller, seated me discreetly in the restaurant away from the diners having fun and romantic meals which was much appreciated. The hotel was boiling hot, it was a humid night in London anyway, but london hotels don't do air conditioning well! All in all, it was a below average experience and I wouldn't rush to do it again - but if it was all that was on offer it isnt so bad that you couldn't put up with it,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at The Raglan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dannimiltonkeynes
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at The Raglan Hotel and had to put a review with you as my friend and I really had a lovely time there. I travel quite often and have stayed in most of the hotels in this area (for work mainly) but decided to spend the weekend and chose The Raglan. It has been one of the best hotels I have stayed in, in the Muswell Hill area. The restaurant food and service was amazing and was made to feel like a queen and then the bar and the bar staff made you feel at home. It was like being in London without the extorionate prices and taxis home as was able to just walk up to my room! The breakfast had a really good choice of food. I had cereal (about 10 choices) and the hot breakfast and it was too much from the portions they have given me. I would so recommend this hotel to anyone as all the staff were very friendly and accommodating. I had to ask the reception to bring me up some ammenities and within 15 minutes they were brought. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all. Thank you The Raglan

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: fussycatEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Raglan four times since February 2006, and each time is worse than the time before. Breakfast Cereal - only one to choose from Fruit juice - only orange juice Fruit - only apples Eggs seem to be in short supply No toast Breakfast overcooked - From the smells percolating into the bedroom, it would appear to be cooked the night before and heated up the next morning Coffee and tea are from thermos jugs Bedrooms No 'do not disturb notices' available Security chain on inside of door broken Key cards appear to only work for 2/3 days and then have to be recharged which involves for ever climbing up and down stairs Parts of the stairs do not have handrails Bedrooms at front suffer from traffic noise - No double glazing. On my last visit in April 2007, was shown to a single room no bigger than a cupboard at the front of the hotel which was very noisy. When I attempted to take a shower there was only cold water. Apparently they were aware of this problem but had still put me in that room. Was offered another room and had to repack my belongings at 10pm at night and move myself - no suggestion of help was offered. This room was at the back and quiet but the radiator didnâ€™t work. I had stayed in the same room four months earlier and had reported the radiator at that time and they still hadn't thought fit to have it repaired. I was awake the whole night suffering from the cold and eventually had to sleep with my clothes on. I reported the radiator again in the morning but by my return in the evening nothing had been done about it. Reported again - and was given an portable heater - thank goodness! Two nights later, at midnight I had a terrible fright as I was awakened to find as one of the staff opening my door to let another guest in. Obviously there had been a mistake over room location but I spent every other night after that with a chair and my suitcase over the door. I had looked forward to an enjoyable relaxing holiday - I was glad to come home.

Reviews.Title: “The Raglan Wins..even when Chelsea don't”
Reviews.Author: James_Pea
Reviews.Content: I'm not a great one for reviewing hotels but I felt the need to register and have my say purely because I disagreed so strongly with a review I saw below. Me an a couple of friends travelled down from Mid Wales to see our beloved Chelsea play on the weekend. The game very disappointing and we felt the trip had been a complete waste of time until our weekend was saved by the treatment we received on return to our hotel. We naturally hit the bar to drown our sorrows and found the staff to be incredibly pollite and helpful despite us being fair from in the high spririts. Having had our mood lightened by some drinks and banter with the bar staff we decided to try to the restaurant, a wedding appeared to be going on but we were still served quickly and the food was absolutely delicious. We will certianly be using the Raglan again next time we come down to London for a match and will be confident that we will have a fantastic time win, lose or draw.

Reviews.Title: “The little gem in Muswell Hill”
Reviews.Author: upnorth01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Raglan hall hotel for three nights and enjoyed every minute of it. From the minute we arrived the whole experience was wonderful. Very happy staff, good clean room, great restaurant and very chic bar. Parking is a bit iffy outside but big car park round the corner. So nice to have a friendly hotel close to Alexandra Palace which I go down to 4/5 times a yearâ€¦.. Do keep it up guys

Reviews.Title: “very impressed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanessasuied
Reviews.Content: WELL DONE RAGLAN HALL. I stayed with the Raglan last week and I must say how pleased I was. I understand they are under new management and since I stayed there last summer the improvement is immense. They have spent a lot of money on the reception, bar and gargens and I really felt warm and comfortable there. The food is 5 star and it was nice to see the same staff there from the last time. I was given a large room facing the front and was happy to see double glazed windows and fresh sheets in a newly refurbished room. CAN YOU BELIEVE IT but I had a room with a television in the bathroom on the second night as I got a free upgrade. There is a concierge who went out and got me a bag of sweets and his help on carrying my bags and getting things for me and the ability to have room service allowed me to be non sociable. I used to write for the Newport Gazette on hotels and bars and I am giving an 8.5 out of 10 as I never give a ten and I am basing this on a three star. I will be staying at this hotel again and a word of advice-try the cocktails in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: salopians
Reviews.Content: Our son chose Raglan Hall as the venue for his recent wedding. All the booking arrangements were handled in a prompt efficient and friendly manner. Upon arrival, we found the hotel clean, comfortable and all the guest rooms used by our party were pleasantly decorated, though some doubles were rather small. The hotel staff were at all times friendly and very helpful, sorting all requests quickly - nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The food was excellent and very good value for money. The bar was a good evening venue for the younger guests, with cocktails available and a DJ. The well laid out garden-patio was a great bonus on a warm, sunny afternoon. We would certainly consider this hotel again if visiting North London. Thank you Raglan Hall!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Awful Awful”
Reviews.Author: borissss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the WORST I have ever stayed in. The room we were in was filthy: -had what looked like bloodstains on the walls and floors; -the carpet and skirting boards were covered in stains, as was the bathroom floor, and there were lots of cobwebs in the bedroom and bathroom; - the extractor fan in the bathroom didn't work (but this was ok, as one pane of the bathroom window was smashed and the window didn't close properly anyway, so we got a lot of ventilation!); - the UHT milk in the tea/coffee basket had gone off, and was more like cheese (I have no idea how long it takes for UHT milk to go off, but I'm sure it must take a while!); - the bedding was stained; - there was no hot water in the shower; - the free movies as stated on the website didn't exist. I informed the recptionist of all of these, and suggested we should get a fairly hefty refund. She offered Â£10 (just more than 10%) and said she wouldn't give me anymore, as it would come out of her wages!! There was no manager in the building, and no way of contacting one for me to speak to. The cooked buffet breakfast was rather good, but only because we got there well in advance of the closing time of 10am. Our friends who got to the breakfast room at 9:45/9:50 to find no cooked breakfast left on the buffet table were told that there would be no further food cooked, and that the staff had other things to do, (although after complaining they eventually got some food.) I took solace from the fact that I wasn't the only one to have a rotten time, as there were plenty of people (mainly our friends) at reception, all complaining, when I left! I am still awaiting a phone call from the manager..... Do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Roseview”
Reviews.Author: Kiernan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago and didn't like its shabbiness so I began staying next door at the Roseview during my regular visits to Muswell Hill. I had seen that the Raglan had been recently refubished and was impressed with the facade and so booked in for 3 nights over the telephone for my latest trip. Upon my arrival, I found that I was not expected but fortunately they had a room vacant. As I started to climb the stairs, I thought that I had been caught in a time warp as nothing 'behind the shop front' had changed. Awful decor, every floorboard creaks - very 1980's seaside B&B. The room, classed as a double was a single with a double bed shoe-horned into it, the sink was cracked and shower fitments were hanging off. I was told that the room was at the back and quiet. It was at the front, not particularly noisy but the curtain didn't fit the small window and so I was woken each morning by the sun about 90 minutes before my alarm sounded. The cheapest meal in the restaurant is about Â£16. Breakfast is completely self-service (no eggs this morning) and surley looking waitresses manage to wipe and set tables around you avoiding eye contact with everyone in case they may have to be pleasant. The bar is nite-club dim. No prices are displayed but beers are about Â£1 dearer than the place next door (rooms are Â£10 per night dearer). The bar staff pour spirits without using measures and you can only have doubles (50ml). In reality, you pay over the odds for a double measure but actually get whatever the barman guesses is enough. One barman thought that it was OK to put ice into a crusher with his fingers straight after handling money. In short, don't be fooled by the glass, mirrors, halogen lights and plasma TVs that you can see from the street; they are just bait dangled to entice you in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nlordship415
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel for my brother and parents. We were all pleasantly surprised by the ammentities and the clean and very well decorated room. Staff was really friendly and accoring to my family breakfast was excellent too. Would reccomend it (sorry no spa or swiming pool) to those that they expect some high standards. They have only stayed for 3 nights from 21st of May but i was visiting quite often and they have all been very friendly and nice. I even changed there for my wedding. I should have stayed there too...:) Bar is nice too but they could not do any cocteils???

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a find! I regularly visit London for business stopovers and usually stay in faceless, corporate hotels. A friend recommended the Raglan and although itâ€™s a bit off the track for central London its definitely worth checking out. Most of my business is in the north London area so its perfect. Seriously great bar, seriously good restaurant, lovely terrace front and back and really helpful and attentive staff. The rooms are nothing special but perfectly fine, clean and comfortable. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March of this year. Thought it was an excellent place. Fair sized rooms, good staff and a beauitful bar, shame the weather didn't allow us to take advantage of the back garden patio, it must be great in the summer. I searched through many London options but wanted somewhere which would be great for central London but not actually based in the middle of town. This hotel matched all my requirements. Will happily stay there again especially as the bar prices are fair, not the usual rip-off!

HotelInfo.Name: Raglan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8-12 Queens Ave | Muswell Hill, London N10 3NR, England
